website_summaries.verdict: With both 11-cup and 3-cup work bowls, this food processor gives you flexibility for different recipes and needs.
pros: ExactSlice System features optimized speeds and an external lever that adjusts thickness of slices
3-in-1 wide mouth feed tube allows large items with little prep
Seal has locking system with leak-resistant ring
Includes discs, blades and a storage case

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Looks really nice, doesn't mix bread crumbs through,cannot shred swiss cheese, it started to smoke and smell and then stopped working. The thing was only 1 week old. We returned it and bought a "cuisinart" for less money.
customer_reviews.author: The C.

customer_reviews.title: Best small appliance in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is a workhorse in my kitchen. I keep it on my counter because I use it so often from making pie crusts, cookie dough, chopping vegetables, grating cheeses and lots of other stuff. The mini bowl is good for chopping small amounts, whipping eggs. The price is reasonable. It is light so I am able to carry it easily. It is easy to clean, no complicated workings. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: cavimom

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed that the lid wasn't better designed to keep items ...
customer_reviews.text: The rubber seal that fits around the lid is loose and flimsy so it moves out of place when I place the lid on. I am disappointed that the lid wasn't better designed to keep items from getting trapped around the hopper when shredding vegetables and cheese. The food processor worked okay.
customer_reviews.author: Okieyankeegirl

customer_reviews.title: I do not like this food processor at all
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this food processor at all. The food gets stuck under the lid. Hard to switch tools. Liked the old one much better. Would like to return.
customer_reviews.author: tom horstman

customer_reviews.title: Saves me a ton on chopped salads!
customer_reviews.text: I’d been buying bags of chopped kale/cabbage/broccoli/Brussels Sprouts so often that I decided I need to make my own. Besides the cost, I always have to chop up the bagged ones further with scissors. This produces the medium fine, very uniform chop that I like in a few seconds!
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Horrible to get clean
customer_reviews.text: I had my original kitchen aid food processor for twenty years it was fabulous. The problem was they didn’t make replacement parts anymore. I ordered this one and it doesn’t even compare. It is difficult to use. It does not grate with ease. It is very hard to get all the parts clean. I had it two years and the bowl and lid have cracked. This is not worth the money. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Jared A Poff

customer_reviews.title: Probably the worst kitchen appliance I’ve ever had!!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of cr@p! Terrible product! Doesn’t always chop everything. Disgusting with the cleaning. I have mold in the lid crevices and the only way to get it out is take it apart.
customer_reviews.author: Anil Adyanthaya

customer_reviews.title: Kitchenaid food processor 11 cup
customer_reviews.text: So my wife like to cook and she does all type of crazy stuff so she like to make her own pasta sauce and always thinking of making different stuff to eat and she always wanted one of these food processor so I got this one for her and man she love it this thing has so many different blade to shred to grind and chop and everything come out so good only thing it’s a pain to clean but beside that great products helps a lot with cooking and making different things home I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: vishal barmadat

customer_reviews.title: Automatic Slicer Is Great
customer_reviews.text: I have had my KitchenAid Food Processor for only three days, but I have used it about six times. I really love it especially the Automatic Slicer. Set it up with the Automatic Slicer Blade, load the food that you want to slice., slide the lever on the outside to select the thickness that you desire, turn the machine on and you have all nice even slices just the way you want them. I have used it to slice onions and tomatoes. Hard or soft vegetables and fruit, makes no difference, it works great. I also liked that it came in the same color to match my other KitchenAid product. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: snowdog

customer_reviews.title: Massive disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because a key part in our previous KitchenAid broke and we couldn’t find a replacement. KitchenAid’s site said this model was the current equivalent. It’s horrible. It’s overly gadget-y, the safety features mean you can’t shred/slice all of what you put in nor can you feed in as much in at a time. It’s overly bulky for no reason. We thought we would adjust to it. Now it’s to late to return. It has no ease of use and does not work well. It is a massive disappointment for the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: this is the worst machine I've ever bought if I could give it to zero Stars I would it doesn't turn on its you can follow the directions all you want you can watch every video it doesn't turn on don't waste your time don't waste your frustrations on this piece of crap
customer_reviews.author: ValerieMB

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves it
customer_reviews.text: My parents were visiting me last year and I wanted to gift them a product which they can use and save time. This is an awesome kitchen product and is multi-functional. They use it all the time. I also have one which I have been using since 2 yrs now. Best investment for Indian kitchens - the dough blade is the magical item. Kneads like a dream. Don't think much, just buy it if you need it - u wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ashutosh Pradhan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Being difficult to clean was hard enough, but I only use it every two weeks to prepare pureed dog food (from cooked chicken and veggies) for a small infirmed dog, so I put up with that aspect. The problem is it is not a long functioning divice. I used this appliance 24 times the first year and 20 this year and it died today mid batch of dog food. So I got 44 uses out of it before it was useless.
customer_reviews.author: Noway

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to clean, too many places to collect food that are impossible to get really clean.
customer_reviews.author: WTR

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect
customer_reviews.text: It’s my second one, my first one was grey and it lasted about 11 years. It works great and have no complaints. I love the white color.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tish

customer_reviews.title: not impressed
customer_reviews.text: dont like it at all, had to return it. It would not stay put on the counter. it would not shut off by hitting the off button, you had to rotate the lid for the safety to shut it down. also none of the buttons would work once it was running. the buttons seemed cheap and obviously non responsive
customer_reviews.author: Tom Schneider

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PROCESSOR
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality, great blade choices and accessories, which come in a very useful storage box. Very well designed and thought out--best processor I have owned. I was dubious about the value because it was relatively expensive, but now see that it is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fast in speed and does the trick, but slides all over the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Julie-goodiegoodieglutenfree

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Wow, bought this to replace my old one (a competing brand) and I am so impressed! Quiet, easy to use and clean. Way more efficient than my old one. The best part is, I can have a conversation while I'm using it!
customer_reviews.author: K. Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Great for everyday
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have owned. I ran the other one to death I used it so much. It is an amazing time saver. I use it when I make soup or other veggie or dough I need to make for my business. The only drawback that I would see is I have to clean it. If it cleaned itself, It would be perfect. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Kitchen Aid Food Processor quite a while ago, replacing one I had for many years and loved. After receiving it I unwrapped it and put in my cabinet for when needed. This past Christmas I decided again to make Christmas cookies and set up the food processor. It does not work - no power, nothing. Because I did not save receipt or box, I am stuck with an item that I cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Runs so quietly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 1993 kitchen aid whose bowl handle had broken. There have been improvements in the last 25 years! I was skeptical when I noticed how much lighter the housing is. However, I have not noticed a lack of power or substance as a result. It is so quiet compared to the old model as well. I’m very happy with the option to change the thickness of my slices as well.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Ohland

customer_reviews.title: worked for 80 to 90 days then all of a sudden now it wont work at all
customer_reviews.text: we used the unit for almost 3 months with no issue and then all of a sudden it wont work at all. you hit low and then pulse and it does nothing. looked at everything on the unit and you can hear when we hit low or high and even pulse but nothing happens - pretty bad that it stop working right after the 90 day warranty expired.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Return defective product model kitchen aid food processor.
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with the kitchen aid food processor. The kitchen aid food processor motor started to smoke where we had to stop using it. I am requesting a refund. You can email at centralcoastjim@yahoo.com or call me at my phone and can leave a voice mail message at my cell phone number at.(520)539-5572 thank James Hilden.
customer_reviews.author: james A Hilden, Jr

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I had one for 15 years and this one definitely not the same quality, And it shakes when I use it. Overall it’s ok
customer_reviews.author: Eric D. Shanklin

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is fabulous, makes cooking from scratch a lot easier. Worth the invest
customer_reviews.author: Mal4

customer_reviews.title: No return
customer_reviews.text: Got this on Amazon from my wedding registry and when I used the food processor, it did not shred anything, everything balled up to mush under the lid and turned into a mess. I tried practically everything and it started to smell like smoke so I stopped using it. Very hard to clean under the lid also. I wanted to return the food processor and Amazon will not take the return, but said to contact Kitchen Aid. They will also not take a return but only a replacement of the item, which I do not desire to have because of the listed issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst food processor. Don't waste your money. It worked fine for 2-3 times so I threw away the box. As soon as I did it began to malfunction. When using the high speed, the blade becomes unlocked from the base and starts making horrible noises until the machine shuts itself off. Now it happens constantly so I can't even use it. Will try to return without the box. I hope this review saves someone else the trouble...
customer_reviews.author: Sammy James

customer_reviews.title: Two have broken with very light and infrequent use
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these and both motors have broken I use it about once a month, if that. Buttons are very hard to push, top doesn't stay closed when in use, not a lot of power to handle grating cheese without a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Liv

customer_reviews.title: Everything Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchase a competitive product and returned it. After the return, I purchased this product. Great features, easy to use and easy to wash/clean. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Go for it
customer_reviews.text: Works great! cleanup is easy but alot of peices. The lid alone is 4 separate peices. The main lid where the safety spring mechanism is (hope its stainless) takes along time to dry - flip it over a few times while its sitting out, to get the water to drain. Not a big deal. I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Added Convenience during Food Prep is Appreciated.
customer_reviews.text: We are pleased with the purchase of this appliance so far. It has made some common chores in the kitchen more efficient with improved outcome vs. our past practice. At this point, we would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good strong food processor.
customer_reviews.text: Good strong food processor. I often watch YouTube cooking videos. I see processors choke up and say to myself, "if they had mine that wouldn't happen".
customer_reviews.author: Felicia HayesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great product but bad packaging for gifts
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is good however the item was shipped in a kitchen aid box rather than an Amazon box which gave away what it was as a present to the recipient. Furthermore the product was in bare sight so it could’ve been stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Trapp

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing for Kitchen Aid appliance. I got way better performance out of my $30 Oster (which I replaced with this one hoping for even more!).
customer_reviews.author: Haris Imamovic

customer_reviews.title: Best food processor
customer_reviews.text: Such a great investment! Easy to use and great quality
customer_reviews.author: Anita E

customer_reviews.title: First use, my wife used this to slice cheese ...
customer_reviews.text: First use, my wife used this to slice cheese. There was a burning plastic smell. The next day she used it to puree peanuts for peanut butter and there is visible smoke! These activities are normal use for the Cuisinart this was intended to replace. But we're returning it instead.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C. Burgoon

customer_reviews.title: Not metal
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model that I loved to death! This one is not metal. The food shoot was redesigned making it more difficult to hand wash. I wish kitchenaid had not remodeled it. As we say in the south, “if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it!”
customer_reviews.author: Carla Cox Brophy

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: If I could rate more stars than 5 I would. Definitely worth the money and it saves so much time in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Hanzo186

customer_reviews.title: very nice. great size bowl for my needs
customer_reviews.text: so handy, came quickly, has box to hold cutters. very nice. great size bowl for my needs. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Brownie

customer_reviews.title: Great food processor
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these we have had. We had the first one for several years and just plain wore it out. Living on a farm we process and freeze/can a lot of food. We never even looked for anything else, we wanted exactly the same thing we had before.
customer_reviews.author: Jory Shelton

customer_reviews.title: The best cookware
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it's a kitchenaid, my girlfriend is a chef and this is all that she wants, she says there's nothing better, and the meals I get, I won't be buying her anything else that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: frankye fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Also really loved the quiet operation
customer_reviews.text: Only tried the small bowl so far, but really appreciated the convenience the smaller bowl provided in quickly and evenly chopping our veggies. In a larger bowl, a small batch would have had widely varying textures. Also really loved the quiet operation.
customer_reviews.author: Semolnar

customer_reviews.title: Like the power it has .
customer_reviews.text: Like the case it has for all the blades to go in it’s easy to clean and just what we needed .
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but not a solid design.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but the base is too light for large jobs and the unit wobbles on the counter. I wouldn't use this for dough.
customer_reviews.author: H. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought on Oct 30th and never used it. Tried to use it today to prepare Christmas dinner and it will not turn on. Tried all the trouble shooting. Problem is return window closed Nov 30th
customer_reviews.author: kami s.

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor
customer_reviews.text: Well made, several attachments for every situation. Easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: RJW5

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: As always, a good Kitchenaid product. Didn't give it a 5 because the biggest cuts are not as big as I'd like for some recipes and to be fair, it might be me not knowing what I am doing.
customer_reviews.author: Kaaren M

customer_reviews.title: my only issue is the chopping size of hard vegetables like carrots, celery etc
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says on the instructions, my only issue is the chopping size of hard vegetables like carrots, celery etc, perhaps I just haven't mastered the art of using it properly yet
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C. D. Waddington

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Son kept no complaints or ask to return. Must be ok. He would be screaming otherwise
customer_reviews.author: gail

customer_reviews.title: Excellent food processor
customer_reviews.text: Took quite a search to find a new processor. I absolutely love this one.
customer_reviews.author: Randi Case

customer_reviews.title: If you cook, buy it! You will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.text: Use to use and easy to clean. Good quality plastic. Glad I spent a little more than some other brands to get this quality product. It cuts down the time to prepare food into a fraction of time it was taking me to chop vegetables and such.
customer_reviews.author: J&B

customer_reviews.title: Efficiency
customer_reviews.text: My wife love it! - We are in Keto diet and food processing is key making our own almond flour, cauliflower muffin's, mixing, etc
customer_reviews.author: Cesar R. Amador

customer_reviews.title: Finicky set up
customer_reviews.text: Is kind of hard to set it up correctly, the safety's interlocks are finicky, but my wife cut herself anyway ( a very small cut, the blades are extremely sharp) there is a big space beneath the blades, hard to process food there.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin RoZemberg

customer_reviews.title: Good food processor
customer_reviews.text: I use a food processor for all grating and chopping needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love my food processor
customer_reviews.text: I love my food processor, I make my own dog food so I chop up like 96 cups of meat and veggies every weekend this has mad the task a whole lot more time efficient thank you!!! And it was easy to learn how to use it thanks again. Monica
customer_reviews.author: monica dicarlo

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for people who like to cook.
customer_reviews.text: Gift for stepdaughter She loves it. It's quiet & powerful.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality food processor. Easy to use and clean. Big enough to handle larger crowds and has a smaller bowl for quick use.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: Really like the quality of this machine. It is a quiet work horse. It does move around however and must be held onto while chopping.
customer_reviews.author: AMathteacher

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The shipment has arrived, but unfortunately some of the parts are not working as required, perhaps incomplete or manufacturers defect
customer_reviews.author: Huda A Albinsaleh

customer_reviews.title: Love my Kitchenaid food processor
customer_reviews.text: Love it, took me a while to figure otu how to use it tho lol
customer_reviews.author: Anita Gray

customer_reviews.title: great food processor
customer_reviews.text: great food processor, easy to use, I really like the fact that we can easily choose different thickness while slicing from very thin to thicker without re opening the food processor. 2 choices for grating, thinner or thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Slv

customer_reviews.title: Cool ideas. Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: Food gets stuck in the lid often! Debris gets stuck in the handle, making it nearly impossible to clean out.
customer_reviews.author: rachelle n

customer_reviews.title: Good unit!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very quiet unit, I used it to shred Ribeye's and it did it with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bill & Monique

customer_reviews.title: Easier to clean than most.
customer_reviews.text: Used it several times now and really like it. it is very versatile. Made everything from Humus to coleslaw. Great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my smaller KitchenAid food processor and I am so happy I did! It is much lighter and much more powerful. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Fran E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Machine
customer_reviews.text: Works well, very quiet, the only drawback is the width of the chute. This was a replacement for a Cuisinart and I prefer the chute on the Cuisinart because it is wider.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rothstein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. For the extra cost the 11 cup is a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great product
customer_reviews.text: You really get what you pay for and this product really proves it
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Love my new food processor
customer_reviews.text: Love my new food processor! I couldn't believe all the attachments it came with. And it is so much quieter than my previous food processor!
customer_reviews.author: Roswitha

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best food processor ,it's powerful, l love it .
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Holley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and the person I bought it for loves it
customer_reviews.author: alice burns

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great food processor! Smooth and quiet and everything you would expect from KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor
customer_reviews.text: Love this food processor.....just used it again this morning. Easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: candy whitt

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and runs quietly. A little tough ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and runs quietly. A little tough to make all the parts fit together, until you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Champ-Doran

customer_reviews.title: Gosh I love being able to decimate fruits and vegetables at the ...
customer_reviews.text: Gosh I love being able to decimate fruits and vegetables at the push of a button. I have never felt so powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Loftis

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Junk!! Am on hold on the phone right now going on half hour!!! Processor jumps around counter when trying to slice sweet potato. Buttons very difficult to push. Too light weight! Kitchenaid has really fallen from grace. Used to be a great company....used to be!! Have several other Kitchenaid appliances, oven, mixer, both large and small, coffee grinder, etc. but after this poor quality will never buy Kitchenaid again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The excellence that I expected from kitchenAid was evident. Quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Struggling with dough making
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid user of food processors for making dough and chopping veggies. My old cuisinart workhorse lasted 10 years and finally the bowl lid broke and I bought the kitchen aid and am struggling 1. It's a terrible dough maker....the motor heats up quickly and stops half way through..I need to manually knead the dough! 2. Chopping is good....though feeder tube is small and onions n veggies needs to be diced to fit. I hate to return stuff ...it's such a pain to pack and ship tho I don't have a choice. Would welcome suggestions from those using it more effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Nikhil Kapur

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Would have been nice to be able to have used as intended for Thanksgiving. I bought this one specifically to match my other KitchenAid appliances. It DID NOT work. I followed all instructions, and had my husband try as well. It's a food processor, not that difficult to figure out. I wished it had functioned properly like for others.
customer_reviews.author: Vanecia Beatty-Calcote

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid 11 Cup
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. We have used it quite a bit since purchasing and it has made easy work out of dicing, shredding, and slicing.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great and is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just opened the product to use and it will not ...
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the product to use and it will not work this was an early Christmas present so my daughter could make food for 6 month old and it does not work. How do I return this item and reorder?
customer_reviews.author: South Dakota Mama

customer_reviews.title: Complexity and cost cutting replace clean supplicity
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the older KitchenAid it replaced (dropped the old lid, no replacement lid available), this unit is much harder to clean, much harder to assemble, seems to be less powerful (or under powered for larger blades), and replaces the heavy metal base with light weight plastic. Basically they gave up clean simplicity for additional features and cost cutting. Even the feed tube pusher must now be disassembled into three pieces to clean! All the black plastic you see in the picture holds water drops and can not be fully dried by hand. If we had examined one in person we would not have purchased this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Messy with a lot of waste
customer_reviews.text: The motor is powerful, but I was a little disappointed with how the grater just mutilates everything. You end up with chunks of everything stuck between the blade and the lid. Lots of waste, unless you have the time to chop up the remnants. In that case, why use this at all? BUT!! It IS great at slicing pepperoni, and I love that you can choose the thickness of the slices.
customer_reviews.author: C H

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Cuisinart with this machine and it’s a dream to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hedge

customer_reviews.title: This appliance has changed my meal prep experience! I ...
customer_reviews.text: This appliance has changed my meal prep experience! I use it so much that it just stays on my counter now. From shredding cheese and cabbage, chopping/slicing veggies, to grinding meat - very versatile and if I was only allowed to have one appliance, this would be it!
customer_reviews.author: Paige Perez

customer_reviews.title: love this! but I cheese gets stuck in the ...
customer_reviews.text: love this! but I cheese gets stuck in the lid even if I freeze the cheese to harden first
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The item came broken, and had to return it. The feed tube mouth is no wider than others.
customer_reviews.author: ESK

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. The blades are sharp and easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: I spent considerable time comparing options before deciding on the KitchenAid to replace my 20 year veteran 7 cup CuisineArt. We don't do large parties very often, so the 11 cup with the 4.5 insert is just right for my kitchen. The variable thickness slicing is not just a gadget. I really like it. The blades are sharp and easy to clean, as are the other parts. Overall, very pleased with powerful and quiet operation. Only negative surprise was the plastic body that looks like metal but isn't. But if it holds up over time, who cares.
customer_reviews.author: PappaJonn

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up and stays in one place on counter ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had Cuisinart's in the past. This unit is stronger, quieter than my other units. Easy clean up and stays in one place on counter without it bouncing around. Very sturdy and does what it is suppose to.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R Persfull

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: Poorly engineered. Lid doesn’t fit work bowl. Poor safety lockout. Unsupportive warranty center. Gave it to donation center with warning.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Chalat

customer_reviews.title: Love my KIthenAid
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful processor. My old one has held up, except the cover, which couldn't be replaced by KitchenAid. This red one is perfect in my really red accented kitchen. Pie pastry is a cinch made with a processor, and love KitchenAid products, and Amazon fast delivery and easy ordering. I am hopeful this new one will give me the same exceptional service as my old KitchenAid. Apple pie coming up, with wonderful processed pastry. I don't recall what year my old KitchenAid was purchased, but it HAS grated, made pastry, chopped, and pureed many times. The red one will be so much more fun to use. It could even be left on the counter; it is so fine looking!!
customer_reviews.author: LOLA COLLINS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing KitchenAid product
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this food processor considering the usual high standards of KitchenAid appliances. The sticky silicon rim of the mixing bowl making removing the top more difficult than it needs to. And water still leaks out of it. The buttons are rubbery and mushy. The blade and bowl didn't churn the food around like my Cuisinart. I was left with over-processed baby food at the bottom and large untouched chunks at top. Check out America's Test Kitchen review which backs up my rating. Sorry KitchenAid, this product is a miss.
customer_reviews.author: Navarro Parker

customer_reviews.title: Weak motor,  died quickly.
customer_reviews.text: The motor on this model is not strong enough. It died within the first weeks of operation. We did not tax the motor with any food or processing technique that were not in the manual. We traded this in for the the 16-cup professional model, which is significantly more expensive, but will be the last food processor we ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Disgusting Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED my old KitchenAid food processor. This one--it does process food (reason it gets two stars rather than one) ; however, one cannot get the parts completely clean. Food works its way into the inner parts of the top and the handle in the main processing bowl. It is disgusting to look at. I have tried all sorts of ways to clean this machine. Also, food often comes out of the bottom of the processor bowl. I cannot recommend this food processor. I wish I could find the Good Will store to whom I I donated my old one. As soon as I can, I am getting rid of this one and will buy another brand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motor smoked during first use.
customer_reviews.text: First and only use: Grating one and a half pounds of cheese, cut into two inch wide sticks. The buttons were hard to press to get it to turn on. When it did turn on it struggled to grate one of the cheese sticks and then the blade stuck about halfway through. Took it apart to see if the cheese was jammed in the blade. No it was fine put it back together same deal. Once I got it to turn on again. Then the motor started smoking. Ended up grating the cheese by hand. Requested a return after dinner. Received a automatic response with free return shipping label, refund showed up on my cc a few days later.
customer_reviews.author: B. Halstead

customer_reviews.title: WORST FOOD PROCESSOR EVER
customer_reviews.text: WORST FOOD PROCESSOR EVER. This food processor cannot make peanut sauce,it cannot even make oat flour from rolled oats. I'm not sure what it is good at, thus far nothing. The machine feels cheap from the moment you pick it up, the motor whirs like a hamster on its wheel. Extremely disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Liesl

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after using twice.  UPDATE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine the first couple times it was used, then quit. Past return window on Amazon and KitchenAid warranty service not very helpful. May want to think about purchasing this unit. Update: Have determined that the shut where food items are inserted was not seated properly. A safety feature that disables the unit until it correctly in place. Works great when everything in in place.
customer_reviews.author: david brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best food processor I have owned. The only thing I didn't like is when you use the 3 cup bowl it's a little hard to get the top on - the key is to make sure the blade setting is lowest and line everything up exactly. I was grinding walnuts and some of the ground nuts got blown into the large bowl but not too much. It's powerful and works well for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: erica

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KFP1133CU 11-Cup Food Processor with ExactSlice System - Contour Silver
product_meta.description: Color:Contour SilverThe KitchenAid 11-Cup Food Processor with the exclusive ExactSlice system, slices from thick to thin with one slide of the lever. The multiple optimized speeds and distinctly designed stainless steel blades help in prepping food. Slice, shred, knead, puree and chop food quickly and easily.
feature_bullets: The externally adjustable ExactSlice System features optimized speeds, and an external lever that allows you to go from thick to thin with one slide of the lever.
The 3-in-1 Wide Mouth Feed Tube lets you accommodate large items—like tomatoes, cucumbers and potatoes with very little prep beforehand. Base Material - Polycarbonate
The UltraTight Seal Features a specially designed locking system with leak-resistant ring that allows you to fill the work bowl to capacity with ingredients without worrying about making a mess.
High, Low & Pulse speed options allow you to precisely and properly handle soft or hard ingredients with the touch of a button.
Model KFP1133 includes 11-Cup Work Bowl, 3-Cup Work Bowl, Adjustable Slicing Disc, Reversible Shredding Disc, Multipurpose Blade, Multipurpose Blade for 3-Cup Work Bowl, Dough Blade, Storage Case.
